card.name: Abu Ja'far
card.ability: When Abu Ja'far dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Aladdin
card.ability: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Aladdin's ability can take control of more than one artifact, although only one each time the ability is used.
8/1/2008 : You do not lose control of the permanent if it stops being an artifact. The validity of the target is checked only on announcement and resolution of the ability.

card.name: Aladdin's Lamp
card.ability: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you use more than one Lamp effect, the second one will end up replacing the card being drawn with the first one.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.ability: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Ali Baba
card.ability: {R}: Tap target Wall.
card.flavor: "When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, ‘Open, Sesame'"The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability may be used to tap more than one Wall per turn if you have enough mana, since tapping isn’t part of the activation cost.
10/4/2004 : The ability may tap walls even when Ali Baba is tapped or just entered the battlefield, since the activation cost doesn't include {T}.

card.name: Ali from Cairo
card.ability: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This effect does not apply to effects which reduce your life without doing damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability works up until Ali enters the graveyard, so if he takes lethal damage or is destroyed at the same time you take damage, the ability helps you. If the damage occurs after it goes to the graveyard, however, it is not affected by the Ali which is no longer on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : This effect does not prevent damage, it prevents the damage from turning into loss of life. So the full damage is dealt (and abilities that trigger on damage being dealt still trigger), but the full loss of life is not applied.

card.name: Army of Allah
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: On the day of victory no one is tired.Arab proverb

card.name: Bazaar of Baghdad
card.ability: {T}: Draw two cards, then discard three cards.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't cast spells or activate mana abilities before discarding the extra cards.

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

card.name: Brass Man
card.ability:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep.  You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

card.name: Camel
card.ability:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
As long as Camel is attacking, prevent all damage Deserts would deal to Camel and to creatures banded with Camel.
card.flavor: Everyone knew Walid was a pious man, for he had been blessed with many sons, many jewels, and a great many Camels.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does prevent damage from animated Deserts in combat.
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: City in a Bottle
card.ability:
Whenever a nontoken permanent from the Arabian Nights expansion other than City in a Bottle is on the battlefield, its controller sacrifices it.
Players can't play cards from the Arabian Nights expansion.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Token creatures and counters created by Arabian Nights cards are not removed.
10/4/2004 : City in a Bottle only affects cards with the Arabian Nights scimitar symbol on them, or permanents that are copies of those cards. It does not affect reprints of cards that originally came from the Arabian Nights expansion.

card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Cuombajj Witches
card.ability: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games you can choose a different opposing player each time it is used. You also don't have to choose the same player that you targeted with the effect (or whose creature you targeted).
10/4/2004 : If either target becomes invalid, the other one is still affected.
10/4/2004 : Both targets are chosen on activation, but you choose your target before the opponent chooses.
10/1/2005 : The two targets can be the same.

card.name: Cyclone
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

card.name: Dancing Scimitar
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

card.name: Dandân
card.ability:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.

card.name: Desert
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability can be used on any player's attacking creatures. This includes your own and creatures in an attack you are not involved in (for multiplayer games).

card.name: Desert Nomads
card.ability:
Desertwalk
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Desert Nomads by Deserts.

card.name: Desert Twister
card.ability: Destroy target permanent.

card.name: Diamond Valley
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

card.name: Drop of Honey
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.
card.ruling:
7/15/2006 : This card's ability is not targeted, so even untargetable creatures or those with Protection can be chosen.
2/1/2007 : If the creature with the least power is indestructible, the ability does nothing.
2/1/2007 : If there are multiple creatures tied for least power and some but not all of them are indestructible, the indestructible ones can't be chosen.

card.name: Ebony Horse
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Elephant Graveyard
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Regenerate target Elephant.

card.name: El-Hajjâj
card.ability: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

card.name: Erg Raiders
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

card.name: Erhnam Djinn
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
10/4/2004 : If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

card.name: Eye for an Eye
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
2/1/2009 : Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

card.name: Fishliver Oil
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)
card.flavor: Then the maiden bade him cast off his robes and cover his body with fishliver oil, that he might safely follow her into the sea.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Flying Men
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Saffiyah clapped her hands and twenty flying men appeared at her side, each well trained in the art of combat.

card.name: Ghazbán Ogre
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.ability: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

card.name: Guardian Beast
card.ability: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they're indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This does not stop sacrifices.

card.name: Hasran Ogress
card.ability: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

card.name: Hurr Jackal
card.ability: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

card.name: Ifh-Bíff Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
{G}: Ifh-Bíff Efreet deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Island Fish Jasconius
card.ability:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep.  You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

card.name: Island of Wak-Wak
card.ability: {T}: The power of target creature with flying becomes 0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Isle of Wak-Wak, home to a tribe of winged folk, is named for a peculiar fruit that grows there. The fruit looks like a woman's head, and when ripe speaks the word "Wak."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This is not an Island.
11/1/2005 : Sets power to 0 instead of giving the creature -X/-0.
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Jandor's Ring
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Discard the last card you drew this turn: Draw a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you do not have the card still in your hand, you can't pay the cost. There is currently no way to prove that it was the card you drew except to get a judge or 3rd party involved, or to put cards you draw aside until you decide whether or not to use this.
10/4/2004 : If you draw more than one card due to a spell or ability, you must discard the last one of those drawn.

card.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

card.name: Jeweled Bird
card.ability:
Remove Jeweled Bird from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{T}: Put Jeweled Bird into the ante. If you do, put all other cards you own from the ante into your graveyard, then draw a card.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The card is exchanged for your entire contribution to the ante. This means that it replaces all the cards if you have more than one already contributed.

card.name: Jihad
card.ability:
As Jihad enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent.
White creatures get +2/+1 as long as the chosen player controls a nontoken permanent of the chosen color.
When the chosen player controls no nontoken permanents of the chosen color, sacrifice Jihad.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : In a multi-player game, it tracks only the chosen player. This is not changed even if this card changes controllers.

card.name: Junún Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

card.name: Juzám Djinn
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, Juzám Djinn deals 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: "Expect my visit when the darkness comes. The night I think is best for hiding all."Ouallada

card.name: Khabál Ghoul
card.ability: At the beginning of each end step, put a +1/+1 counter on Khabál Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : The effect counts all creatures put into all graveyards from the battlefield during the turn. This includes creature tokens put into a graveyard as well as creatures put into a graveyard before Khabál Ghoul entered the battlefield.

card.name: King Suleiman
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target Djinn or Efreet.
card.flavor: "We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon . . . And many of the devils We also made obedient to him."The Qur'an, 21:81

card.name: Kird Ape
card.ability: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

card.name: Library of Alexandria
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You may tap multiples of these in response to each other because the requirement for 7 cards is checked only at the time the ability is announced and not again when it resolves.

card.name: Magnetic Mountain
card.ability:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

card.name: Merchant Ship
card.ability:
Merchant Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Whenever Merchant Ship attacks and isn't blocked, you gain 2 life.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Merchant Ship.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Metamorphosis
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Metamorphosis, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is one plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Mijae Djinn
card.ability: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The coin flip is done as a triggered ability on declaring the Djinn as an attacker.
10/4/2004 : If the Djinn attacks, but you lose the coin toss, then it is still considered to have attacked, and any other abilities that trigger on it attacking will resolve normally.
10/4/2004 : Any abilities which have already resolved before the coin flip are not undone. Any abilities that trigger when it attacks which have not already resolved will still resolve.

card.name: Moorish Cavalry
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

card.name: Nafs Asp
card.ability: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of his or her next draw step unless he or she pays {1} before that draw step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
10/4/2004 : The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player's turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.
10/4/2004 : If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
10/4/2004 : The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.

card.name: Oasis
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

card.name: Old Man of the Sea
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Old Man of the Sea during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power for as long as Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and that creature's power remains less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You lose control of the creature if the Old Man leaves the battlefield. This is because it is no longer tapped.
10/1/2009 : If Old Man of the Sea stops being tapped before its ability resolves -- even if it becomes tapped again right away -- you won't gain control of the targeted creature at all. The same is true if the targeted creature's power becomes greater than Old Man of the Sea's power before the ability resolves.
10/1/2009 : The ability doesn't care whether Old Man of the Sea remains under your control, only that Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and its power remains large enough. If an opponent gains control of Old Man of the Sea, you'll keep control of the affected creature (until Old Man of the Sea stops being tapped or it no longer has enough power).
10/1/2009 : Once the ability resolves, it doesn't care whether the targeted permanent remains a legal target for the ability, only that it's on the battlefield and its power remains small enough. The effect will continue to apply to it even if it gains shroud, stops being a creature, or would no longer be a legal target for any other reason. If it stops being a creature, its power is considered to be 0.

card.name: Oubliette
card.ability:
When Oubliette enters the battlefield, exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature.
When Oubliette leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the exiled Aura cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : If Oubliette leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature forever.
9/16/2007 : If the targeted creature is a token, it will cease to exist after being exiled. Any Auras that were attached to it will remain exiled forever.
9/16/2007 : If the exiled card is returned to the battlefield and, for some reason, it now can't be enchanted by an Aura that was also exiled by Oubliette, that Aura will remain exiled.

card.name: Piety
card.ability: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."The Qur'an, 24:52

card.name: Pyramids
card.ability: {2}: Choose one — Destroy target Aura attached to a land; or the next time target land would be destroyed this turn, remove all damage marked on it instead.

card.name: Repentant Blacksmith
card.ability: Protection from red
card.flavor: "For my confession they burned me with fire And found that I was for endurance made."The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Ring of Ma'rûf
card.ability: {5}, {T}, Exile Ring of Ma'rûf: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : Ring of Ma'rûf works a little differently than the Wishes from others sets. Rather than letting you simply put a card into your hand from outside the game, this ability replaces your next draw. If you wouldn't draw a card during the rest of the turn, the ability won't have any effect.

card.name: Rukh Egg
card.ability: When Rukh Egg dies, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the Rukh Egg card is removed from the graveyard in the same turn it is put there, a Bird will still be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is exiled instead of being put into the graveyard, no Bird is put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : Text-changing effects can be used to change the color of the Bird that will be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is destroyed while under the control of another player, the controller of the Egg gets the Bird.

card.name: Sandals of Abdallah
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. When that creature dies this turn, destroy Sandals of Abdallah.

card.name: Sandstorm
card.ability: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
card.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

card.name: Serendib Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you.
When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of the land is done during the resolution of the triggered ability. You also choose the land at that time.

card.name: Serendib Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Shahrazad
card.ability: Players play a MAGIC subgame, using their libraries as their decks. Each player who doesn't win the subgame loses half his or her life, rounded up.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : At the start of the sub-game both players draw their initial hand (usually 7 cards). If one player has fewer cards than required, that player loses. If both have fewer than required, both players lose.
10/4/2004 : Events in a Shahrazad sub-game do not normally trigger abilities in the main game. And continuous effects in the main game do not carry over into the sub-game.
10/4/2004 : You randomly chose which player chooses to go first or draw first.
7/15/2007 : At the end of a subgame, each player puts all cards he or she owns that are in the subgame into his or her library in the main game, then shuffles them. This includes cards in the subgame's Exile zone (this is a change from previous rulings).

card.name: Sindbad
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.
card.ruling:
9/25/2006 : If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Sindbad's ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
9/25/2006 : To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.

card.name: Singing Tree
card.ability: {T}: Target attacking creature's power becomes 0 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Changes creature's current power to zero (as opposed to giving it -X/-0, like before) but does not prevent raising it after the Tree has been used on it.
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Sorceress Queen
card.ability: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen becomes 0/2 until end of turn.

card.name: Stone-Throwing Devils
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: Sometimes those with the most sin cast the first stones.

card.name: Unstable Mutation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

card.name: War Elephant
card.ability: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: "When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers."Kikuyu Proverb
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Wyluli Wolf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"Maimun al-Wyluli, Diary

card.name: Ydwen Efreet
card.ability: Whenever Ydwen Efreet blocks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Ydwen Efreet from combat and it can't block this turn. Creatures it was blocking that had become blocked by only Ydwen Efreet this combat become unblocked.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The ability triggers any time Ydwen Efreet blocks.

card.name: Army of Allah
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: On the day of victory no one is tired.Arab proverb

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Erg Raiders
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

card.name: Fishliver Oil
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)
card.flavor: Then the maiden bade him cast off his robes and cover his body with fishliver oil, that he might safely follow her into the sea.

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.ability: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

card.name: Hasran Ogress
card.ability: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

card.name: Moorish Cavalry
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

card.name: Nafs Asp
card.ability: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of his or her next draw step unless he or she pays {1} before that draw step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
10/4/2004 : The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player's turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.
10/4/2004 : If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
10/4/2004 : The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.

card.name: Oubliette
card.ability:
When Oubliette enters the battlefield, exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature.
When Oubliette leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the exiled Aura cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : If Oubliette leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature forever.
9/16/2007 : If the targeted creature is a token, it will cease to exist after being exiled. Any Auras that were attached to it will remain exiled forever.
9/16/2007 : If the exiled card is returned to the battlefield and, for some reason, it now can't be enchanted by an Aura that was also exiled by Oubliette, that Aura will remain exiled.

card.name: Piety
card.ability: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."The Qur'an, 24:52

card.name: Rukh Egg
card.ability: When Rukh Egg dies, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the Rukh Egg card is removed from the graveyard in the same turn it is put there, a Bird will still be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is exiled instead of being put into the graveyard, no Bird is put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : Text-changing effects can be used to change the color of the Bird that will be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is destroyed while under the control of another player, the controller of the Egg gets the Bird.

card.name: Stone-Throwing Devils
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: Sometimes those with the most sin cast the first stones.

card.name: War Elephant
card.ability: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: "When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers."Kikuyu Proverb
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Wyluli Wolf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"Maimun al-Wyluli, Diary
